Description: Rim sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres; exterior: narrow brown band at top of rim above zigzag frieze between narrow lines.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by World Museum, Liverpool. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding the rim pattern, see British Museum 1924,1201.505 and 1924,1201.144.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 306, no. 1230, pl. 160)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2018) (phase 2)
